intro: Pasania acuminatissima, commonly known as the sharp-pointed pasania, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, clustered in small umbels, and it produces small, dry fruits. Pasania acuminatissima is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
